ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write a long academic paper.
How to perform novel research at an individual level.
Learned a lot about synthesizing massive amounts of information into a handful of key points. Also, had to learn the importance of time management and planning
I was able to apply everything Ive learned to this senior thesis.

I 'learned' how to put a large body of work together. I use quotes because it is just so open of a project that one almost feels like they taught themselves.  I did not go to my advisor nearly as much as I could have or maybe should, but they did help to add structure to the paper to increase comprehension.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A few check ins during the semester with Professor Weir would be very helpful.

Strengths: love the flexibility in drafts, topics, and advisors. Daniel the graduate student advisor was wonderful and always available. Professor Weir was also helpful.

Weakness: Little infrastructure tying students writing senior essays together (would be great to do something in-person in future years). Also was difficult at first to find an advisor.

Probably could have used a more formal structure from EP&E with more reasonable deadlines. (Going from proposal to draft in 4 weeks makes no sense when we're given 5 weeks to go from draft to final draft. To put that in perspective, we have about as much time to produce a draft as our readers have to grade the final paper.)

EP&E offers a lot of freedom in choosing and pursuing your senior essay, but the drawback there is that the department provides very little guidance about how to go about the senior essay. There is no criteria apart from addressing Ethics, Politics, and Economics in your essay, which is liberating but also difficult when attempting to assess whether you're on the right track. As a result, it's especially important to pick a good advisor who will shepherd you through the the process. The department, for better or worse, provides very little oversight, so your advisor will be your lifeline.
This was a great summary to the major!
I did not receive feedback on the essay (that I know of), which might have been essay.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Super glad I did it!
I suppose there isn't too much of a choice on this one, but I definitely recommend doing the yearlong thesis (one semester just goes by so quickly)
Yes!!! A great summary to the major.
You do not have a choice
